definitions.definition: Being a generalization of a perfect number . For a given natural number k , a number n is called k -perfect (or k -fold perfect) iff the sum of all positive divisors of n (the divisor function, σ(n)) is equal to kn .

main_definition: ( mathematics ) Being a generalization of a perfect number . For a given natural number k , a number n is called k -perfect (or k -fold perfect) iff the sum of all positive divisors of n (the divisor function, σ(n)) is equal to kn .
